meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tendentious.
meanings.sent1: Her tendentiousnesses in the debate were evident as she only focused on one side of the argument.
meanings.sent2: The article's tendentiousnesses made it clear that the author had a strong bias.
meanings.sent3: Despite his tendentiousnesses, his friends always appreciated his unwavering loyalty.
meanings.sent4: The tendentiousnesses of the political campaign were like a thick fog, obscuring the truth.
meanings.sent5: The tendentiousnesses of the conspiracy theory were so extreme that it seemed like a work of fiction.

meanings.definition: A tendency to present a particular point of view or opinion.
meanings.sent1: His tendentiousnesses in the meeting made it difficult to have a balanced discussion.
meanings.sent2: The journalist's tendentiousnesses were evident in the way she framed the news story.
meanings.sent3: Despite his tendentiousnesses, his humor always lightened the mood in serious conversations.
meanings.sent4: The tendentiousnesses of the movie director were like a paintbrush, coloring every scene with his perspective.
meanings.sent5: The tendentiousnesses of the marketing campaign were so persuasive that it swayed many opinions.
